Question 2.Question: The wealth of a nation depends on the volume of its
Question 2.Explanation: The wealth of a nation depends on the volume of its multi-lateral trade. Multilateral trade agreements are commerce treaties among three or more nations. The agreements reduce tariffs and make it easier for businesses to import and export.

Question 3.Explanation: Skilled and unskilled labor can be easily differentiated from each other in that the former is accompanied by training and education.

Question 4.Explanation: A doctor who attends to a patient at home after his official duty is referred to as a direct worker.

Question 5.Question: Manufacturing and constructive activities are classified under
Question 5.Explanation: Manufacturing, as well as constructive activities are well classified under secondary production. Secondary production is the manufacturing and assembly process. It involves converting raw materials into components

Question 6.Question: The rewards rents, wages, interests and profits accrue from
Question 6.Explanation: The reward for land, labor, capital and entrepreneur are rent, wages, interest and profit respectively. Factors of production are owned by households and they supply these factors of production to firms and in return earn rent, wages, interest and profit.

Question 7.Question: The factor of production that is subject to depreciation is
Question 7.Explanation: Factors of production are the inputs needed for the creation of a good or service. The factor of production that is subject to depreciation is capital.

Question 8.Question: Division of labor ultimately leads to
Question 8.Explanation: The division of labor is the separation of tasks in any economic system or organization so that participants may specialize (specialization). Division of labour generally also increases both producer and individual worker productivity.

Question 9.Question: A worker who processes rice is engaged in
Question 9.Explanation: A worker who processes rice is engaged in manufacturing activities. This is because such worker as transformed the product to a finished good.

Question 10.Question: After-sales service is a function usually rendered by
Question 10.Explanation: After-sales service is any support provided to a customer after the product or service has already been purchased. It is a form or means of promoting and enhancing sales. This feature function is usually rendered by the retailer.

Options.Value: After-sales service
Branding
Self-service

Question 11.Explanation: A trend in relating which enables customers to have free access to different products is self-service.

Question 12.Explanation: Wholesales are regarded as the activity which entails buying of goods in bulk and selling in small quantities to retailers.

Question 13.Question: The comparison of a country's visible and invisible exports and imports expressed in monetary term is
Question 13.Explanation: The comparison of a country's visible and invisible export and import expressed in monetary terms is referred to as Terms of trade. The terms of trade shows the relationship between export prices and import prices.

Question 14.Question: The document that gives an importer a freehand to obtain goods from any manufacturer is
Question 14.Explanation: An open indent can be defined as the document that gives the importer a free hand to obtain goods from any manufacturer. It is an order to an overseas purchasing agent to buy certain goods, without specifying the manufacturer.

Question 15.Question: Entreport trade usually occurs in
Question 15.Explanation: Entreport trade usually occurs in importing goods to be exported. Entreport trade is a commercial operation whereby goods are imported into a country and re-exported without distribution within the importing country

Question 16.Question: The document issued to a port authority when goods deposited is a
Question 16.Explanation: The dock warrant is a document issued to a port authority when goods are deposited. A dock warrant certifies that the holder is entitled to goods imported and warehoused in the docks. It transfers the absolute right to the goods described in it.

Question 17.Explanation: The details of the goods required by the purchaser are outlined in an indent. It is an official order or requisition for goods.

Question 18.Explanation: Dumping in international parlance, refers to a situation where goods are sold to foreign countries at a price far below than the marginal cost.

Question 19.Explanation: Advertising is the process of creating more market for products. It makes the public aware of the goods and services rendered by the firm as well as disclosing relevant information.

Question 21.Explanation: The best mode of ensuring that items ported get to the named addressee is through registered mail. Registered mail is a mail service offered by postal services in many countries, which allows the sender proof of mailing via a mailing receipt and, upon request, electronic verification that an article was delivered or that a delivery attempt was made.

Question 22.Explanation: Hull insurance is an insurance policy especially designed for covering ship damage expenses. A business who undertakes the hull insurance policy is aiming at covering damages to the body of the ship.

Question 23.Question: An agent who brings a customer into business contact with his principal is known as
Question 23.Explanation: A broker is defined as an agent who brings a customer into business contact with the principal. A broker who also acts as a seller or as a buyer becomes a principal party to the deal.

Question 25.Question: The warehouse that is owned and controlled by the government is a
Question 25.Explanation: The warehouse that is owned and controlled by the Government is a state warehouse. Goods in a State warehouse are subject to applicable customs and excise laws and procedures, which include the State warehouse Policy and Procedure Manual.

Question 26.Question: One of the main features of a partnership is
Question 26.Explanation: A partnership is a formal arrangement by two or more parties to manage and operate a business and share its profits. One of the main features of partnership is its lack of corporate existence.

Question 27.Explanation: A trust is an arrangement by firms who are independent to share the market of their products on quota basis.

Question 28.Explanation: A ring is an illegal arrangement by manufacturers to control the price or conditions of the sale of product.

Question 29.Question: A public company with an authorized capital of N60,000, issued 36,000 shares at 150k each. What is its capital?
Question 29.Explanation:
Authorizes share capital = N60,000

Issued share capital = 36,000 shares @150k each

= 36,000 × N 1.5

= N54,000

Question 31.Question: A characteristics of money which ensures that is value is not lost is
Question 31.Explanation: A characteristic of money which ensures that its value is not lost is relative scarcity. The relative scarcity of money compared to goods and services will allow money to retain its purchasing power.

Question 32.Explanation: The instrument used in the capital market is the debenture. Debentures are long term borrowed funds of the company. They have fixed maturity period as well as fixed interest rate. These are the certificates issued under common seal of the company.

Question 38.Explanation: The best pricing strategy for a company that produces warm clothing is a target return pricing. A target return is a pricing model that prices a business based on what an investor would want to make from any capital invested in the company.

Question 40.Question: The label on a product such as pampers is a type of
Question 40.Explanation: The label on a product such as 'pampers' is a type of branding. Branding is used to assign a unique identity to the product so that customers can easily differentiate it with other products available in the market.

Question 41.Question: An opportunity to reject a binding contract at will by a third party is said to be a
Question 41.Explanation: An opportunity to reject a binding contract at will is said to be a voidable contract. A voidable contract, unlike a void contract, is a valid contract which may be either affirmed or rejected at the option of one of the parties.

Question 42.Explanation: An agency contract must involve a principal and an agent. Agency can be defined as the relationship between two persons, wherein a person has the authority to act on behalf of another, bind him/her into a legal relationship with the third party.

Question 47.Explanation: The major problem confronting cyber cafe operators is copyright violation by the clients. Copyright violation means that the rights afforded to the copyright holder, such as the exclusive use of a work for a set period of time, are being breached by a third party.

Question 48.Explanation: A device that enables the downloading of information from the internet is the modem. A modem is a hardware device that connects a computer or router to a broadband network.

Question 49.Explanation: In E-banking, ATM means Automated Teller Machine. It is a fast and comfortable means of withdrawing cash from one's bank account.

Question 50.Explanation: One-way by which a business can discharge its social responsibility to its community is to build public health centers. Such centers could be free.
